entry.title: Composable Storefront specific configuration by environment in SAP Commerce Cloud
entry.content:
Introduction

Natively Composable Storefront / SAP Commerce Cloud doesn't support dynamic configuration. The only exception is regarding OCC EndPoint : OCC_BACKEND_BASE_URL_VALUE

  • https://me.sap.com/notes/0003437564
  • https://me.sap.com/notes/0003211483

And it is well known issue in Spartacus : https://github.com/SAP/spartacus/issues/5772

This article will explain how we can easily extend SAP Commerce Cloud and Composable Storefront to fill this gap. As example, we will use SAP CDC integration.

 

SAP Commerce

First thing is to extend OCC API BaseSite to enrich output with additional settings: occ/v2/basesites?fields=BASIC / BaseSitesController.getBaseSites()

For that, you need to create two custom extensions one for the core and for occ

 

Core extension

In custom core extensions, you need to extend BaseSite item to record CDC settings (*items.xml)

<itemtype code="BaseSite" autocreate="false" generate="false">
<attributes>
 <attribute type="java.lang.String" qualifier="cdcJavascriptUrl">
  <persistence type="property" />
  <modifiers optional="false" />
  <description>CDC EndPoint with API Key</description>
</attribute>

<attribute type="int" qualifier="cdcSessionExpiration">
 <persistence type="property" />
 <modifiers optional="false" />
 <description>CDC session expiration time in seconds</description>
</attribute>
</attributes>
</itemtype>

  Then Data and WsDTO beans need to be extended too (*beans.xml)

<bean class="de.hybris.platform.commercefacades.basesite.data.BaseSiteData">
 <property name="cdcJavascriptUrl" type="String"/>
 <property name="cdcSessionExpiration" type="Integer"/>
</bean>

<bean class="de.hybris.platform.commercewebservicescommons.dto.basesite.BaseSiteWsDTO">
 <property name="cdcJavascriptUrl" type="java.lang.String">
 <description>Indicates CDC EndPoint with API Key</description>
 </property>
 <property name="cdcSessionExpiration" type="java.lang.Integer">
 <description>Indicates CDC Session Expiration time</description>
 </property>
</bean>

A new Populator should be introduced to add new settings in Data object (*spring.xml)

<bean id="cdcBaseSitePopulator" class="com.basesite.populator.CDCBaseSitePopulator"></bean>

<bean parent="modifyPopulatorList">
 <property name="list" ref="baseSiteConverter" />
 <property name="add" ref="cdcBaseSitePopulator" />	
</bean>

Popular implementation should look like to this

public class CDCBaseSitePopulator implements Populator<BaseSiteModel, BaseSiteData> {

@Override
public void populate(final BaseSiteModel source, final BaseSiteData target) throws ConversionException {
 target.setCdcJavascriptUrl(source.getCdcJavascriptUrl());
 target.setCdcSessionExpiration(source.getCdcSessionExpiration());
 }
}

To influence correctly Spring configuration, custom core must depend on commercefacades extension (extensioninfo.xml)

<requires-extension name="commercefacades"/>

 

OCC extension

OCC extension should be created according official documentation. The purpose is to extend WsDTO mapping for including additional CDC settings.

In /occ/v2/*occ/web/spring/*-web-spring.xml file, you can declare this following additional attributes

<!-- It extends baseSiteWsDTOFieldSetLevelMapping bean from commercewebservices -->
<bean parent="fieldSetLevelMapping" id="cdcSiteWsDTOFieldSetLevelMapping">
 <property name="dtoClass" value="de.hybris.platform.commercewebservicescommons.dto.basesite.BaseSiteWsDTO"/>
 <property name="levelMapping">
 <map merge="true">
 <entry key="BASIC"
	value="cdcJavascriptUrl,cdcSessionExpiration"/>
 </map>
</property>
</bean>

 

Testing

After this customisation, you can compile and startup SAP Commerce Cloud. Then, you should connect to BackOffice for setting up the CDC settings in WCMS

Following that, you should be able to see the result by call OCC API BaseSite : https://localhost:9002/occ/v2/basesites?fields=BASIC

...
<baseSites>
<cdcJavascriptUrl>JS_SDK_URL_PLACEHOLDER_ELEC</cdcJavascriptUrl>
<cdcSessionExpiration>3600</cdcSessionExpiration>
<channel>B2C</channel>
<isolated>false</isolated>
<name>Spartacus Electronics Site</name>
<uid>electronics-spa</uid>
</baseSites>
</baseSiteList>

 

Composable Storefront

In client side, several things must be customised :

  • BaseSite POJO class needs to be extended
  • CdcConfig class needs to be override
  • Cdc configuration has to be dynamically loaded

Type augmentation is clearly documented over here : https://sap.github.io/spartacus-docs/type-augmentation/

CDC dynamic loading can be executed by overriding static CdcConfig through Angular provider

Let first create a new module cdc.feature.module.ts that will inject CDC dynamic loading class

@NgModule({
  declarations: [],
  imports: [CdcRootModule],
  providers: [
    {
        provide: CdcConfig,
        useClass: DynamicCdcConfig
    },
    provideConfig({
      featureModules: {
        [CDC_FEATURE]: {
          module: () => import('@spartacus/cdc').then((m) => m.CdcModule),
        },
      },
    })
  ],
})

export class CdcFeatureModule {}

DynamicCdcConfig class should look like this

import { BaseSiteService } from "@spartacus/core";
declare module '@spartacus/core' {
    interface BaseSite {
      cdcJavascriptUrl?: string,
      cdcSessionExpiration?: number
    }
  }

@Injectable()
export class DynamicCdcConfig extends CdcConfig {
    
    constructor(protected baseSiteService: BaseSiteService) { 
        super();
        this.baseSiteService
          .getActive()
          .subscribe((currentBasesite) => (
            this.baseSiteService.get(currentBasesite).subscribe((value) => (
                this.cdc = [
                  {
                    baseSite: currentBasesite,
                    javascriptUrl: value?.cdcJavascriptUrl as string,
                    sessionExpiration: value?.cdcSessionExpiration as number,
                  }
                ]
              ))
        ));
    }
}

 Then new module must be imported in app.module.ts to be loaded at startup

@NgModule({
  declarations: [
    AppComponent,
    StaticPageComponent
  ],
  imports: [
    BrowserModule,
    StoreModule.forRoot({}),
    AppRoutingModule,
    EffectsModule.forRoot([]),
    SpartacusModule,
    CdcFeatureModule
  ],
  providers: [provideHttpClient(withFetch(), withInterceptorsFromDi()),],
  bootstrap: [AppComponent]
})
export class AppModule {}

 

Conclusion

As we saw, specific configuration by environment can be easily implemented in Composable Storefront. But If you need more support, please don't hesitate to contact SAP Expert Services.

entry.title: Is it possible to change the icon of the "No items availabe" message in a Table?
entry.content:
I recently stumbled upon the possibility of changing standard texts in a UI via the i18n files.

Via

"enhanceI18n": "i18n/customSalesOrderLR.properties"

 you can add files to "enhance" the standard i18n files as described here.

If a table can't get items it displays such a message which is changeable via the "enhancement" i18n file.

Now I was curious if it is possible to also change the icon which is displayed in a table, when there are no items available.

entry.title: Missing parameter values - CrystalDecisions Runtime for .NET
entry.content:
Hello, hopefully someone can assist

We are enountering the error "Missing parameter values" when exporting a report document. The report in question has 60 parameters and I have double checked and triple checked the parameters and made sure a value is supplied for all of them, but still get this error.

Is there any functionality in CrystalDecisions that identifies which parameter this error is relating to?

Or is there anything else that might be causing this error even when a value is provided for all parameters?

Stack trace:

Reading records
Reading records - Complete
Compiling report
Compiling report – Complete
Records Selected: 19
Exporting report
Exporting report - Complete
CrystalDecisions.CrystalReports.Engine.ParameterFieldCurrentValueException: Missing parameter values.
---> System.Runtime.InteropServices.COMException: Missing parameter values.
at CrystalDecisions.ReportAppServer.Controllers.ReportSourceClass.Export(ExportOptions pExportOptions, RequestContext pRequestContext)
at CrystalDecisions.ReportSource.EromReportSourceBase.ExportToStream(ExportRequestContext reqContext)
--- End of inner exception stack trace ---
at CrystalDecisions.ReportAppServer.ConvertDotNetToErom.ThrowDotNetException(Exception e)
at CrystalDecisions.ReportSource.EromReportSourceBase.ExportToStream(ExportRequestContext reqContext)
at CrystalDecisions.CrystalReports.Engine.FormatEngine.ExportToStream(ExportRequestContext reqContext)
at CrystalDecisions.CrystalReports.Engine.FormatEngine.Export(ExportRequestContext reqContext)
at CrystalDecisions.CrystalReports.Engine.FormatEngine.Export()
at CrystalDecisions.CrystalReports.Engine.ReportDocument.Export()
at Monitor.Fep.Application.ReportGateway.ReportProcessorCrystalDecisions.DoReport()
at Monitor.Fep.Application.ReportGateway.ReportProcessor.FetchReport(String documentKey)
Gateway processing the response for document key of: 3_638908609542889837

 

Additional context

Our application is writting in C#

The report file in question was created using SAP Crystal Reports 2020 desktop application

The report uses a Command to retrieve the data. The command executes a single procedure, and the input parameters for said procedure are filled out using the command parameters

e.g. 

EXECUTE PROCEDURE my_proc({?Parameter1}, {?Parameter2}, {?Parameter3}) 

etc.

The parameters are of several different types: Integers, Strings, Booleans etc.

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud / Business Partner - Handling of Multiple internationl addresses
entry.content:
Hello Experts,
we are currently having issues during the implementation of multiple international addresses during the migration to SAP Public Cloud. 
What we want to do is, to create a Business Partner (customer) with 4 different addresses that have different usages like standard address, invoice adress, shipping adress  and a custom adress type in 2 different languages (english and german). So one Businessparter has potenialy 8 different addresses. 

I have mainly two quesions about this case. First, is there even a way in SAP public cloud to create custom address usage types, because the latest information i found from 2023 was that it isnt possible. If this is the case how can we create a structure for different addresses that dont fall under the standard address usage types.

My second question would be about the effect of the field "country/region", in each address, on the output determination. To my knowledge the field "language" in the BP Masterdata is used to determine the correct country version of the form for example during the invoice creation and which is not address specific, is this correct ?.
Because if so how can we customize a BP, that has one address in germany and one in the US, so that in one case the invoice is in german and if it goes to the  address in the US its in english.

We are thankfull for all suggestions

Best regards
Lukas

entry.title: Trends in B2B Commerce Webcast
entry.content:
Привіт, Community!

Зовсім скоро відбудеться вебкаст про майбутнє B2B-комерції. Подія базується на свіжому дослідженні 2025 State of B2B eCommerce Report від Master B2B.

📅У вівторок, 9 вересня 2025 року о 13.00, запрошуємо на онлайн-сесію «Тренди B2B-комерції 2025: як подолати бар’єри на шляху до розвитку». Її проведе Меганн Йорк, Global Head of Product Marketing в SAP Commerce Cloud, а спеціальним гостем стане наш клієнт — компанія Arauco.

Поговоримо про виклики, з якими стикається B2B-комерція сьогодні: організаційну складність, потребу в цифровому лідерстві та інші фактори, що часто гальмують трансформацію. Ми покажемо, як бізнеси успішно поєднують технології, таланти та партнерство, щоб рухатися вперед. Ви отримаєте конкретні ідеї та стратегії, які допоможуть керувати складними процесами й ефективно використовувати цифрові інструменти для досягнення цілей.

Реєструйтеся за посиланням.

entry.title: Re: Is it possible to change the icon of the "No items av...
entry.content:
As you can see in the method determing that Illustration, it is hardcoded, like with "illustrationType: IllustratedMessageType.NoSearchResults"  from the IllustratedMessageType Enum and can not be changed:

	setTableNoDataIllustratedMessage: function (table: Table, bindingInfo: CollectionBindingInfo) {
		const tableFilterInfo = TableUtils.getAllFilterInfo(table);
		const resourceModel = getResourceModel(table);
		const suffixResourceKey = bindingInfo.path?.startsWith("/") ? bindingInfo.path.substring(1) : bindingInfo.path;
		let illustratedInformation: $IllustratedMessageSettings;

		const getNoDataIllustratedMessageWithFilters = function (): $IllustratedMessageSettings {
			if (table.data("hiddenFilters") || table.getQuickFilter()) {
				return {
					title: resourceModel.getText("T_ILLUSTRATED_MESSAGE_TITLE_NOSEARCHRESULTS"),
					description: resourceModel.getText("M_TABLE_AND_CHART_NO_DATA_TEXT_MULTI_VIEW", undefined, suffixResourceKey),
					illustrationType: IllustratedMessageType.NoSearchResults
				};
			}
			return {
				title: resourceModel.getText("T_ILLUSTRATED_MESSAGE_TITLE_NOSEARCHRESULTS"),
				description: resourceModel.getText("T_TABLE_AND_CHART_NO_DATA_TEXT_WITH_FILTER", undefined, suffixResourceKey),
				illustrationType: IllustratedMessageType.NoSearchResults
			};
		};

		const filterAssociation = table.getFilter();
		const hasFilterOrSearch = tableFilterInfo.search || tableFilterInfo.filters?.length;
		if (filterAssociation && !/BasicSearch$/.test(filterAssociation)) {
			// check if a FilterBar is associated to the Table (basic search on toolBar is excluded)
			if (hasFilterOrSearch) {
				// check if table has any Filterbar filters or personalization filters
				illustratedInformation = getNoDataIllustratedMessageWithFilters();
			} else {
				illustratedInformation = {
					title: resourceModel.getText("T_ILLUSTRATED_MESSAGE_TITLE_NOSEARCHRESULTS"),
					description: resourceModel.getText("T_TABLE_AND_CHART_NO_DATA_TEXT", undefined, suffixResourceKey),
					illustrationType: IllustratedMessageType.NoSearchResults
				};
			}
		} else if (hasFilterOrSearch) {
			//check if table has any personalization filters
			illustratedInformation = getNoDataIllustratedMessageWithFilters();
		} else {
			illustratedInformation = {
				title: resourceModel.getText("T_ILLUSTRATED_MESSAGE_TITLE_NODATA"),
				description: resourceModel.getText("M_TABLE_AND_CHART_NO_FILTERS_NO_DATA_TEXT", undefined, suffixResourceKey),
				illustrationType: IllustratedMessageType.NoData
			};
		}
		if (CommonUtils.getTargetView(table).getViewData().liveMode) {
			illustratedInformation = {
				title: resourceModel.getText("T_ILLUSTRATED_MESSAGE_TITLE_NOSEARCHRESULTS"),
				description: resourceModel.getText("T_TABLE_AND_CHART_NO_DATA_TEXT_WITH_FILTER"),
				illustrationType: IllustratedMessageType.NoSearchResults
			};
		}
		illustratedInformation.illustrationSize = (table.getParent() as TableAPI).getNoDataMessageMode();

		if (illustratedInformation.illustrationSize === "text") {
			const currentNoData = table.getNoData();
			if (typeof currentNoData === "string" && currentNoData === illustratedInformation.description) {
				// We don't change the noData aggregation unnecessary.
				return;
			}
			table.setNoData(illustratedInformation.description);
		} else {
			this.setNoDataInformation(table, illustratedInformation);
		}
	},

entry.title: Re: regex allows the space
entry.content:
Hi Team,

 

This is the expected behavior:

(i). we have a process that sanitizes fields that have a trailing space to remove it

(ii). we have a process that validates the regEx

 

It makes sense that the regEx is validated on the value that is about to be saved after the sanitization, not the value that is sent - i.e., we are doing (i). before (ii).

 

Best Regards,

SAP Solution Support

entry.title: Re: Criticality on Table Card in Fiori Elements OVP
entry.content:
Turns out that criticality on Table Card has to be defined using Data Point. 
I have therefore used following annotation:

      @ui: { lineItem: [{position: 10,
                         label: 'Due Date',
                         qualifier: 'OpenObligations',
                         type : #AS_DATAPOINT }] ,
             dataPoint: { criticality: 'DueDateCriticality' }  }
      DueDate,

and that did the trick:

Happy Coding everyone 😎

entry.title: SAP Stammtisch Magdeburg 09/25: Was macht die Basis von morgen?
entry.content:
Wir laden euch herzlich zum nächsten SAP Stammtisch Magdeburg ein! Diesmal dreht sich alles um die Frage: „Was macht die Basis von morgen?“

Kostenlose Anmeldung über Eventbrite: https://sap-stammtisch-magdeburg-09-25.eventbrite.de

Freut euch auf spannende Vorträge:

▶️ „Von der Tradition zur Innovation: Was Unternehmen für die Integration von Cloudanwendungen wie SAP S/4HANA Cloud, BTP und Co. organisatorisch umstellen müssen“
Erfahrt, welche organisatorischen Veränderungen, neuen Rollen und kulturellen Anpassungen notwendig sind, um Cloud-Lösungen wie SAP S/4HANA Cloud und die SAP Business Technology Platform erfolgreich einzuführen und zu betreiben.

▶️ "Die Odoo Story – Moderne Technologie, Open Source und technologischer Hype"
Im Fokus stehen die Entstehung des Open Source ERP-Systems Odoo, seine Besonderheiten sowie aktuelle und zukünftige Entwicklungen.

▶️ "AIOps für traditionelle SAP-ERP-Systeme"
Im Fokus stehen die Herausforderungen zwischen traditionellem ITIL-basiertem Betrieb und der Einführung von KI-Funktionen. Besonders relevant ist dabei die Frage: „Wie sollen wir das betreiben und verwalten?“

Natürlich kommt auch das Networking nicht zu kurz: Für Pizza und Bier/Softdrinks ist wie immer gesorgt.

🕖 Einlass ab 18:30 Uhr, Vortragsstart um 19:00 Uhr

Wir freuen uns auf euch!

__________

We cordially invite you to the next SAP Stammtisch Magdeburg! This time, everything revolves around the question: “What will form the basis of tomorrow?”

Free registration via Eventbrite: https://sap-stammtisch-magdeburg-09-25.eventbrite.de

Look forward to exciting presentations:

▶️ “From tradition to innovation: What companies need to change organizationally to integrate cloud applications such as SAP S/4HANA Cloud, BTP, and others”
Learn what organizational changes, new roles, and cultural adjustments are necessary to successfully introduce and operate cloud solutions such as SAP S/4HANA Cloud and the SAP Business Technology Platform.

▶️ “The Odoo Story – Modern Technology, Open Source, and Technological Hype”
The focus is on the emergence of the open source ERP system Odoo, its special features, and current and future developments.

▶️ “AIOps for Traditional SAP ERP Systems”
The focus is on the challenges between traditional ITIL-based operations and the introduction of AI functions. The question “How should we operate and manage this?” is particularly relevant here.

Of course, there will also be plenty of opportunity for networking: Pizza and beer/soft drinks will be provided as always.

🕖 Doors open at 6:30 p.m., presentations start at 7:00 p.m.

We look forward to seeing you there!

entry.title: Mapping of rating for calibration
entry.content:
Hello experts, 

We have a Calibration template that relies on the sysOverallPerformance (performance score) and sysOverallPotential (potential score) Portlets.

The Performance score comes from a Form with a 4-point rating scale. However, the Calibration matrix must be based on a grouping of scores: 1->1, 2->2 and 3-4 -> 3.

I first thought of loading these "grouped" scores into the sysOverallPerformance portlet, but the element import functionality requires exporting all the "trend" Portlets and then reloading them with the update. The manipulation is cumbersome and remains risky.

Do you have another solution to recommend ?

Thank you in advance for your help.

entry.title: 🇪🇸 Event-driven integrations with SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh (Barcelona, Spain)
entry.content:
This SAP CodeJam instance will be about Event-driven integration using SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh. Join us for this 5-hour event of developer networking and hands-on learning in Barcelona, Spain.

We will achieve an integration scenario like the one in the diagram below by the end of the CodeJam.

If you are interested in knowing what we will develop during the event, check out the Event-Driven Integrations with SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh GitHub repo -  https://github.com/SAP-samples/event-driven-integrations-codejam. The repository contains the details of the integration scenario we will go through during the event.

This free, hands-on, in-person event (not virtual) takes place Thursday, the 2nd of September 2025, in Barcelona, Spain, @ CINC - Carrer de Llull, 321, Sant Martí, 08019 Barcelona. The event is kindly being hosted by Code10, thank you!

The instructor for this event is Developer Advocate Antonio Maradiaga.

There are essential prerequisites that every attendee must complete before arriving at the event location. You can find the prerequisites here: https://github.com/SAP-samples/event-driven-integrations-codejam/blob/main/prerequisites.md.

If you wish to attend, please indicate that using the "Yes" button in the Will you be attending?  box on this page. Please note that spaces are limited - we can only accommodate 25 attendees for this event. In that context, if you indicate that you're attending and later realise you can't, please remove your name so that others get a chance instead. Thanks!

Location: CINC, Carrer de Llull, 321, Sant Martí, 08019 Barcelona

entry.title: Re: Implementação da NT 2024.003
entry.content: Olá Andre, pelo que vi até o momento, não há uma nota separada para a criação do grupo "agropecuario" no XML. Implementamos as notas da Reforma, em conjunto com as 3560404 e 3560477, além da 3527792 (PI) e a tag foi introduzida no XML. O problema que vi é que no PI a SAP criou apenas uma estrutura para os defensivos e o guia de trânsito, enquanto que no ERP dividiram em duas, o que está dando problema.

entry.title: Re: EAM: F6065 : Features Send Output/Output status are g...
entry.content: Thank you Raymond. I could see it now.

entry.title: Re: Variable Pay Worksheets - Objectives appearing only for the one of the two Bonus Plans
entry.content: Without seeing the actual configuration, it is hard to say what the issue might me. However, you need to check the goal file to ensure the goal has the appropriate field linked from the history file and the goal weight file to ensure there is the connection between the goal, the bonus plan and the weighting of the goal in the goal plan. If those mappings are wrong or incomplete, the issue you re seeing will arise.

entry.title: CREATING CAPM APPLICATION WITH NODE.JS BY USING S/4 HANA DATABASE
entry.content:
Hello All,

In this Blog I would like to share some knowledge on how to Create a basic CAPM application using Sap Business Application Studio and we are going to use the SAP S/4Hana system to connect and fetch the data.

Lets Divide this Blog into two sections:

1. Prerequisites

2. CRUD Operation

In this Blog lets see what are all the subscriptions and settings to be done to start our application.

Let.. Set.. Go!!

NOTE: May Be This Blog Seems To Be Lengthy, Still Give It A Try U Will Surely Love IT 🙂 

Step1: Lets Subscribe to SAP HANA CLOUD:

Open your SAP BTP trial account and navigate to Service Market Place. Search for S/4 Hana Cloud

After Selecting HANA Cloud, you will get the screen like below and Please click on Create.  

 

Click on Tools and then Create.

Once you click on View Subscription , here it shows as below image

Note: Remember after subscribing any service you should add security because every service will have its own Role Collections.

Now lets navigate to Users and Click on Default Identity Provider.

Click on Assign Role Collections, there you can find roles related to Hana cloud( You will find all the roles for the services that are subscribed).

 

Select them and click and assign.

You can find them under your role collections. Now you have your HANA DB. Lets open it.

Step2: Open SAP HANA Cloud and Lets Create Instance.

Click on Create Instance and then select HANA Cloud DB.

 

Here its asking us from which environment our service is going to run, So we need to sign in to Cloud Foundry with your Default Identity Provider Credentials( your email id).Then it returns you this Message.

 

 

 

Select your space which is default given as dev ( I renamed its as Dev). Instance name can be anything of your choice.

 

Enter any password of your choice.

Now leave the next step as it is with storage of 16gb and next please select allow all IP addresses so that it will not block any.

Click on the three dots over there and there you will find an option to Start. In 10 to 15min your instance would be running.

Step 3: Setup Work Zone(Fiori Launch Pad):

Search in Market Place > Work Zone

Click Create 

Please select the Plan as Subscriptions > standard. 

Our Subscription would be in progress.

Note: If this error exists, please subscribe to your Cloud Identity Services.

If you get this, please add trust configuration. So follow the steps below

Initially follow the same process of Subscribing Cloud Identity Provider User Role Collections

Fix: Configure OIDC Trust in SAP BTP

  1. Log in to SAP BTP Cockpit
    Go to your subaccount where you want to subscribe to the application.
  2. Go to Security → Trust Configuration
    This is where you manage identity provider (IdP) trust settings.
  3. Add SAP Cloud Identity Services as an OIDC IdP
    • Click Establish Trust.
    • Choose SAP Cloud Identity Services.
    • Select OpenID Connect (not SAML).
    • Enter the required details (Issuer URL, Client ID, etc.) — if you have Identity Authentication service (IAS) set up, you can copy these from there.
  4. Set as Default for Business Users

                   Make sure the new OIDC IdP is assigned to business users in your subaccount.

  1. Save & Retry Subscription
    Go back to the subscription page and try again.

Assign the Role collections to users what are all available. Check them all and Click on Assign.

Step 4: CREATE A HANA DB INSTANCE:

Navigate to Service Market Place > Select HANA DB > Create > Under Plan select the Instance.

 

Step 5: Subscribe to Business Application Studio.

Note: By default SAP Business Application Studio would be subscribed. If not subscribe it by yourself.

References:

https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/

https://help.sap.com/fiori_bs2013/helpdata/en/a7/1564526ba1f25fe10000000a423f68/content.htm?no_cache...

 
Will Work on next topic in coming Sessions..
Hope it’s helpful 

Thanks,
Divya MANDAVA.

this.dispatchEvent(

detail: { lat, lon, radiusKm }

);

Is there a specific way SAC passes event.detail into the scripting editor?
Any guidance or example would be really helpful.

entry.title: Re: 50 measurement documents are displayed from IE02/IE03
entry.content:
Dear Jaya

You could work around the 50-Document Limit by
1. Using IK17 or IK18 Directly

Go to transaction IK17 (Display Measurement Documents List) or IK18 (Change Measurement Documents List), and set broader criteria—such as:

Date range

Measurement point or equipment
This allows you to list all relevant measurement documents without the 50-record cap.

2. Utilizing Custom Query or Report

If IK17/IK18 still doesn't meet your needs, consider developing a custom ABAP report or query:

Read directly from tables IMRD (measurement documents) and IMRG (document items).

Apply filters like equipment number, measurement point, and date range to retrieve all records.

3. using ABAP Debugging Option (Technical Insight)

For technical teams:
Use ABAP debugging to trace IE03 behavior:

Check the function module or screen logic—typically within IMR0 function group.

Identify where the selection is limited to 50 documents, allowing potential enhancements via user exits or adjustments.

Best regards

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Public Cloud equivalents of OMX2 and OMX3
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,


The tcodes related to OMX2 are to activate Material Ledger per currency type/area. In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, Material Ledger is activated by default in the system, so there is no specific app/configuration needed for that.


Regarding Currency settings, you can use configuration activity / SSCUI "Define Currency Settings for Ledgers and Company Codes" to set it:

Currencies | SAP Help Portal


Best Regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Give a Kudo, Get a Badge
entry.content:
Last week, we began to assign badges based on the number of kudos a member received. But what about the members who kindly grant kudos? Don’t they deserve some recognition, too?

We think so, and that’s why, starting tomorrow (Wednesday, September 3), we’re launching our latest progression set – based on kudos given.

As with the other badges that we recently rolled out, this set contains five badges, the first of which has been available since the launch of our current platform last year. The rest are new. You make your way through the set as your activity meets the associated criteria. With these badges, you’ll acquire the second one after giving 30 kudos, the third after 75, the fourth after 200, and the fifth and final after 500.

That’s a whole lot of kudos clicked!

Badges will start appearing in people’s “My content” area tomorrow – and we’ll require a few hours to assign them all. Since we’ll once again award them retroactively, you can already anticipate what you’ll attain (if anything) by looking at your accrued activity. How? Here’s a refresher.

After logging in, select “My content” from the dropdown in the upper right.

Once you’ve navigated to your “My content” page, look for the gray box at the top. This area contains several stats, including “Kudos given.” As an example, I’m once again turning to my anonymous friend (who was the source of my screenshots for previous posts).

With more than 1,700 kudos given, he’ll complete the set during tomorrow’s rollout (having surpassed the threshold for all of the new badges…and then some!).

That’s some serious gold-medal kudo judo!

Now if you were so inclined, you could go give hundreds of kudos right now (although your finger might get sore from clicking all those thumbs), ensuring that you also complete the set tomorrow. But your kudos carry way more weight when you dole them out deservingly. Why give them away randomly when you can make another member’s day by delivering a kudo that sincerely indicates that you read and appreciated his or her content?

As someone who writes frequently for SAP Community, I can attest to the warm and fuzzy feeling that comes from a kudo. Clicking that thumb is such a simple act, yet its impact is undeniable for the recipient. It sends the message: “I like what you did. Thank you.” For that reason, I’m glad to see that our community’s cool kudo givers can earn rewards for their generosity.

If you expect to gain one or more “kudos given” badges tomorrow, then let me give you a big thumbs up in advance. Also, as a reminder: If you don’t see your badges by Thursday, September 4, please log out and in again. And if you haven’t racked up the necessary numbers yet for the full set, don’t worry. You can always win the badges later by reading and reacting to contributions throughout the community.  

In conclusion: Keep the thumbing coming for the content that you like, and make sure to check back next week. We plan to unveil more progression badge sets in September, and we’ll announce them weekly right here in What’s New. In the meantime, remain an active, positive member, and you may find yourself surprised with even more badges this month.

entry.title: Re: Cost Component split in Professional Service Scenario...
entry.content:
Hello @Johannes_Wienho 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, you can fully break down the rate of an internal activity type, such as services or project work, into detailed cost components within Margin Analysis. SAP offers the Primary Cost Component Split feature specifically for this purpose.

Unlike traditional product costing, which relies on materials, BOMs, and routings, the Primary Cost Component Split enables detailed analysis of internal activities usually recorded as secondary cost elements. By configuring the following elements, you can achieve the necessary transparency.

  • Define a Cost Component Structure to specify and categorise the cost types relevant for your business, such as Employee Related Costs, Technical Infrastructure, and Licence Cost.
  • Create a splitting structure to explain how costs posted to secondary cost elements via activity allocations will be mapped to the underlying primary cost components, ensuring each activity’s cost composition is reported accurately.
  • Assign the Splitting Structure to your control area to enable it for all related activity postings.
  • Plan your activity rates based on cost components, enabling the system to allocate and report actual costs in Margin Analysis according to the defined standards breakdown.

  • Cost Planning with Cost Component Breakdown: When setting prices for your activity types, you need to determine not just the overall rate (€10) but also how this rate is divided among the main cost components.

When activity allocations are posted, SAP S/4HANA Cloud uses this configuration to report costs in Margin Analysis at the specified level of detail, enabling accurate profitability analysis for services and projects.

For additional official information, refer to SAP Help: Cost Components in S/4HANA Cloud

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: 回复： 高级公司间销售和高级公司间库存转储 2208版本常见问题集锦
entry.content:
Hi,

我使用了5D2的业务场景，按照官方的配置文档，一个公司需要创建两个业务伙伴，一个代表公司，一个代表工厂。例如，公司A，就要创建业务伙伴A1代表公司，创建业务伙伴A2代表工厂；公司B，就要创建业务伙伴B1代表公司，创建业务伙伴B2代表工厂。

我创建了公司A对外的销售订单，由公司B交付，最终创建公司间客户发票时，发现公司B的客户对应是业务伙伴A2（代表工厂），而系统自动生成的公司A的供应商发票，供应商是业务伙伴B1（代表公司）。

我的问题是，为什么不是同时是使用代表公司或工厂的业务伙伴？是否可以只设置一个业务伙伴？

entry.title: Error while updating CashFlowAssignments of JournalEntries with Service Layer
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I’m trying to assign a Cash Flow Line Item to a Journal Entry line using Service Layer. My payload looks like this:

{
  "JournalEntryLines": [
    {
      "Line_ID": 0,
      "CashFlowAssignments": [
        {
          "PaymentMeans": "pmtBankTransfer",
          "CashFlowLineItemID": 63,
          "JDTLineId": 0
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}

 

If there is already a record in OCFT (Cash Flow Transactions table), and I specify CashFlowAssignmentsID, the request works.

But when no record exists in OCFT yet, I get the following error:

{
  "error": {
    "code": -2028,
    "message": {
      "lang": "en-us",
      "value": "No matching records found (ODBC -2028)"
    }
  }
}

My question: How can I create a new CashFlowAssignments row for a Journal Entry line via Service Layer when no OCFT row exists yet?

Thanks in advance for your guidance!

entry.title: Can a communication point act as a clarification point and as a normal exit point simultaneously?
entry.content:
Dear experts,

Is there a way to handle the scenario where on an MFS-controlled pallet conveyor system there is a communication point that acts as the clarification point, but there are also "normal" routings that go thru it, so it's also a normal exit point?

In our experience if a communication point is set up in customizing as a clarification point (because in e.g. 60% of the cases it's actually a clarification point), then when an HU arrives there that has no MFSERROR, and has a destination outside of the MFS-controlled conveyor system, then it gets stuck on the clarification point with only an inactive ('waiting') warehouse task. Of course this is due to the fact that the /SCWM/MFS_WT_DET FM doesn't bother creating an active task from LOSC because the CP is set up as a clarification point. But does this mean that this is a binary choice and so a CP can only act as either a clarification point, OR a conveyor exit point? Is there any standard customizing solution to this, or any way with a custom development to solve it?

Of course, we could set up two CPs for the same physical conveyor point (1 for the clarification point, and 1 for the exit point), but I'd rather avoid it if possible.

Thanks very much in advance!

 #EWM-MFS #Communication point

@Dominik_Tylczynski @florian_kuchta2  @Jrg_Michaelis

entry.title: Re: How to improve the performance of prepared statements...
entry.content:
Hi Michael,

jConnect 4 7.07 is old and most likely 15.x version.
jconn4.jar has been around for many years. It switched from 7.07 to 16.
It isn't released any longer though and jconn42.jar is released going forward.
This has JDBC 4.1 and 4.2 standards.
You can see the version with command:
java -jar jconn4.jar
java -jar jconn42.jar

For your question. Stored procedure are not affected by DYNAMIC_PREPARE=true.
This property is for prepared statements. This property will generate a stored procedure for each query.
Example:
select * from table where column1 = ?
Turns into
create proc dyn100 as select * from table where column1 = ?

This can affect performance as metadata and TDS is sent to generate this stored proc on the fly.
If you do not execute the same query multiple times during a connection this can be overhead that hurts performance.
This proc creation is every prepared statement and is regenerated every new connection. Connection pooling doesn't affect this and is still regenerated.
You may want to check if DYNAMIC_PREPARE=false helps. This was the old default in jconn3.jar.

Hope that helps,
Ryan
